comment.author: 7806261@N06
comment._content: Visited 1938. Interesting radio antennae on the cross arms. May have been involved in signals intel? Post visit, many of the Counts social contacts where rounded up.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/miniop] Fascinating stuff!  Nazi spies in Sydney ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: "I believe in love at first sight. Countess von Luckner's Romance" - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/17467452 Von Luckner extensive wikipedia article - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Felix_von_Luckner

comment.author: 7806261@N06
comment._content: He was a very interesting character indeed.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/miniop] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks to both of you for your links. Amazing that she's still sailing! Also, the National Archives of Australia does have his file open for access online. Search Luckner through their collection search: www.naa.gov.au/collection/search/ Fascinating stuff! I feel yet another blog coming along.
